Required Application Materials
  • A resume is required in order to apply.
  • A letter of Interests is required in order to apply
  • A list of 3 professional references is required in order to apply.

In order to be considered, applicants must have uploaded all required materials in a combined document and must have completed all sections in their on-line application.

 
Purpose of Position

Works under minimal supervision to direct, plan, manage, and develop organizational operations of UT Rio Grande Valley.  Participates in administrative consideration of all policies, plans and programs of UT Rio Grande Valley related to the compliance, safety, human resources, and short and long range planning areas.

 
Essential Functions
  • Develops, plans, directs, leads, and manages organizational operations and activities.
  • Develops and administers institution policies and long-range goals and objectives.
  • Reviews analyses of activities, budgetary costs, operations, and forecasts to determine progress toward stated goals and objectives.
  • Determines and establishes work priorities and staffing needs, including staff development and training.
  • Provides leadership to ensure the University meets all compliance and safety regulatory requirements including title IX, and title VII compliance and ensures compliance with all other appropriate state and federal government regulations and standards.
  • Oversee and manage Human Resources, Police and Safety, Compliance, Space Planning and other assigned departments.
  • Responsible for design, execution, and effectiveness of system of internal controls, which provides reasonable assurance that operations are effective and efficient, assets are safeguarded, and financial information is reliable.
  • Ensures compliance with applicable laws, regulations, policies and procedures.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

 
Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree and ten (10) years progressively responsible administrative and budgetary work in university and business environments.

 
Preferred Qualifications

Work requires strong written, interpersonal, customer service, analytical, and supervisory skills. Demonstrated success in planning, problem solving, and managing highly skilled work force. Ability to make sound judgments and recommendations regarding complex human resource matters. Ability to design and implement pragmatic, timely solutions. Work requires ability to be team player, bringing creative and innovative approach to management. Responsibility for review, development, recommendation, and implementation of policies. Responsibility for development and tracking of budget accounts. Exercise of considerable judgment and great attention to detail.

 
Working Conditions
  • UT-RGV is a distributed institution which requires presence at multiple locations throughout the Rio Grande Valley.
  • Work is performed primarily in general office area.
  • This position is security-sensitive and thereby subject to the provisions of Texas Education Code §51.215.

 
Additional Information

The retirement plan for this position is Teacher Retirement System of Texas (TRS), subject to the position being at least 20 hours per week and at least 135 days in length. This position has the option to elect the Optional Retirement Program (ORP) instead of TRS, subject to the position being 40 hours per week and at least 135 days in length.

Complete all sections on the application, including highest level of education, college degrees (if applicable), references and all questions on the application questionnaire.  If you are applying for the first time make sure to complete all biographical information including address, email and phone.  You may update this at any time by selecting to edit your profile in the application.

Security sensitive; conviction verification conducted on applicant selected.

 
EO/AA Statement

The University of Texas System is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or sexual orientation. Reasonable disability accommodation may be requested by contacting the Office of Employee Services.

Job Description
Job Title:
UTRGV - Interim Dean for the College of Liberal Arts
Job ID:
1410

Full/Part Time:
Full-Time

Regular
Return to Previous Page
Posting Description

FLSA Status

Exempt

Earliest Start Date

Immediately

Monthly Salary

To be determined.

Hours per Week

Full-time on an interim basis, with night and weekend hours as required

Hiring Department

The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (UTRGV)

Please Note

Our on-line application allows you to upload only a single document when applying for a position.  Please review the Required Application Materials section below, then save those three materials into a single, combined PDF or Word document.

Required Application Materials

  • Curriculum Vitae
  • Letter of interest
  • A list of five (5) professional references

To be considered, applicants must have uploaded all required materials in a combined document and must have completed all sections in their on-line application.

Purpose of Position

For the duration of this interim appointment, the Interim Dean will:

  • Fulfill the unique leadership opportunity of serving as the chief academic officer of a college that includes Humanities (e.g., English, Communication Studies, Modern Languages and Literature, Philosophy, History, and Mexican American Studies) and Social and Behavioral Sciences (e.g., Psychology, Criminal Justice, Public Administration/Policy, Anthropology, Political Science, and Sociology).
  • Be responsible for the College’s academic and research programs, working with faculty to articulate a shared vision of excellence, and focusing on developing, expanding, and strengthening excellent academic programs in the Liberal Arts.
  • With broadly delegated authority, further the mission of the University by expanding resources, strengthening regional, national, and global connections and building collaboration amongst College disciplines and across the University.
  • Work with the senior leadership team and the University community to implement UTRGV’s guiding principles (see https://www.utsystem.edu/sites/utsfiles/news/assets/Guiding-Principles-UT-Rio-Grande-Valley-06-10-13.pdf).
  • Ensure student success is at the core of College’s mission and goals.
  • Play a key leadership role in ensuring the success of our students by requiring excellent and ongoing academic and student support services designed to increase retention and graduation rates at the College level while maintaining the highest standards of academic excellence.
  • Ensure student success in and beyond the classroom by building educational and student life programs that are proactive, intentional, and based on the individual needs of UTRGV’s students.
  • Propel UTRGV along its path to becoming an emerging research institution. As such, the Interim Dean must work with faculty to develop, expand, and strengthen the college’s research portfolio, with a focus on increasing externally funded research, as well as building graduate programs at the master’s and doctoral levels.
  • Integrate student engagement and experiential learning initiatives throughout the student life cycle that will enable students to become productive citizens who value and pursue community engagement as a mechanism to contribute to our society, locally and globally.
  • Promote, encourage, and incentivize interdisciplinary collaborations within the College and across the colleges at UTRGV.
  • Develop and foster strong academic and research collaborations with the School of Medicine.

Essential Functions

Reporting to the Provost and Executive Vice President for Academic Affairs and on an interim basis, the Interim Dean of the College of Liberal Arts will:

  • Serve as the chief academic officer for the College of Liberal Arts.
  • Effectively and efficiently provide leadership and direction to all the academic and research programs and centers that fall within the College of Liberal Arts.
  • Facilitate continuous, effective, and seamless interaction, engagement, and coordination between the different units in the College of Liberal Arts.
  • Be responsible for enhancing and invigorating the academic programs; inspiring faculty, staff, and students; and creating synergy among the disciplines, within and across the academic colleges.
  • Promote, encourage, and support shared governance.
  • Work on developing a college environment that promotes and values communication, collaboration, and coordination, and that fosters collegiality.
  • Be an intellectual leader who will foster and promote the highest standards of academic excellence, state-of the art research/scholarship, and active community engagement.
  • Be responsible for budgetary and administrative oversight and strategic planning within the College.
  • Actively lead the College in strengthening its economic portfolio by expanding external research funding; developing and securing financial support through local and national foundations; and increasing gifts and endowments through active engagement in philanthropy.
  • Ensure active engagement of faculty, staff, and students with the external community.
  • Represent the University in the community on matters pertaining to the College.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

Required Qualifications

  • Ph.D. or terminal degree in field of study.
  • A strong record of academic and scholarly accomplishments, progressive leadership experience, and qualification for tenure at the rank of full professor within the College.
  • At least three (3) years of continuous administrative experience.
  • Strong background and proven experience within academic affairs, including developing successful academic and research programs, and active engagement in philanthropy.
  • Appropriate administrative experience, including responsibility for budgets, management of personnel, hiring of faculty and staff, and overseeing performance review for faculty retention, tenure, and promotion.
  • Proven experience working in a master’s or doctoral granting university.
  • Proven experience in working across divisions (e.g., Academic, Student, and Business Affairs, University Advancement, and Information Technology).

Preferred Qualifications

  • Proven leadership and management skills in developing and working with teams and developing active and successful partnerships that include faculty, staff, students, and external constituent groups.
  • Ability to communicate in a pragmatic and collegial way.
  • Proven scholarly record in student success.
  • Proven success with externally-funded research grants.
  • Proven ability to integrate multiple departments.

Working Conditions

  • UTRGV is a distributed institution.  As such and as assigned, the position may require presence at multiple locations throughout the Rio Grande Valley.
  • Work is performed primarily in a general office environment
  • This position is security-sensitive and thereby subject to the provisions of the Texas Education Code §51.215. 

Additional Information

This position is an administrative appointment to UTRGV, and as such, the appointee will serve at the pleasure of the President.  Additionally, this appointment does not automatically confer a tenured faculty appointment upon the individual selected;  tenure may be conferred only by The University of Texas System Board of Regents.

The retirement plan for this position is Teacher Retirement System of Texas (TRS), subject to the position being at least 20 hours per week and at least 135 days in length. This position has the option to elect the Optional Retirement Program (ORP) instead of TRS, subject to the position being 40 hours per week and at least 135 days in length.

Complete all sections on the application.  If you are applying for the first time please complete all biographical information including address, email and phone.  You may update this at any time by selecting to edit your profile in the application.

Security sensitive; conviction verification conducted on applicant selected.

EO/AA Statement

The successful applicant must be able to demonstrate eligibility to work in the United States.  The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, veteran status, or disability. Women and minorities are strongly encouraged to apply.

  • Be responsible for budgetary and administrative oversight and strategic planning within the College.
  • Actively lead the College in strengthening its economic portfolio by expanding external research funding; developing and securing financial support through local and national foundations; and increasing gifts and endowments through active engagement in philanthropy.
  • Ensure active engagement of faculty, staff, and students with the external community.
  • Represent the University in the community on matters pertaining to the College.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

Required Qualifications

  • Ph.D. or terminal degree in field of study.
  • Strong record of academic and scholarly accomplishments, progressive leadership experience, and qualification for tenure at the rank of full professor within the College.
  • At least three (3) years of continuous administrative experience.
  • Strong background and proven experience within academic affairs, including developing successful academic and research programs, and active engagement in philanthropy.
  • Appropriate administrative experience, including responsibility for budgets, management of personnel, hiring of faculty and staff, and overseeing performance review for faculty retention, tenure, and promotion.
  • Proven experience working in a master’s or doctoral granting university.
  • Proven experience in working across divisions (e.g., Academic, Student, and Business Affairs, University Advancement, and Information Technology).

Preferred Qualifications

  • Proven leadership and management skills in developing and working with teams and developing active and successful partnerships that include faculty, staff, students, and external constituent groups.
  • Ability to communicate in a pragmatic and collegial way.
  • Proven scholarly record in student success.
  • Proven success with externally-funded research grants.
  • Proven ability to integrate multiple departments.

Working Conditions

  • UTRGV is a distributed institution.  As such and as assigned, the position may require presence at multiple locations throughout the Rio Grande Valley.
  • Work is performed primarily in a general office environment.
  • This position is security-sensitive and thereby subject to the provisions of the Texas Education Code §51.215. 

Additional Information

This position is an administrative appointment to UTRGV, and as such, the appointee will serve at the pleasure of the President.  Additionally, this appointment does not automatically confer a tenured faculty appointment upon the individual selected;  tenure may be conferred only by The University of Texas System Board of Regents.

The retirement plan for this position is Teacher Retirement System of Texas (TRS), subject to the position being at least 20 hours per week and at least 135 days in length. This position has the option to elect the Optional Retirement Program (ORP) instead of TRS, subject to the position being 40 hours per week and at least 135 days in length.

Purpose of Position
  •   Ensure that student success, which is at the core of UTRGV’s mission, is implemented in every aspect of the student experience.
  • Ensure student success in and beyond the classroom by building educational and student life programs that are proactive, intentional, and based on the individual needs of UTRGV’s students.
  • Work with the senior leadership and the University community to implement UTRGV’s guiding principles (see https://www.utsystem.edu/sites/utsfiles/news/assets/Guiding-Principles-UT-Rio-Grande-Valley-06-10-13.pdf).
  • Integrate next-generation technology and customized learning to increase affordability and maximize student success.
  • Ensure seamless transfer of students from community colleges and other universities to minimize time to degree.
  • Promote a student-and service-centered approach to the entire student experience.
  • Integrate student engagement and experiential learning initiatives throughout the student life cycle that will enable students to become productive citizens who value and pursue community engagement as a mechanism to contribute to our society, locally and globally.
  • Provide a holistic approach to student success from recruitment, to enrollment, to graduation with the primary goal of increasing student success through increased student retention and timely graduation of educated citizens who are life-long learners.
  • Provide comprehensive advising, mentoring, and coaching, when and where needed, region-wide to ensure student success in the classroom and beyond.
  • Integrate into one division Enrollment Management, Student Life, and Student Academic Support Services, which may include a first-year program, an honors program, advising, tutoring services, career services, student conduct, transfer services, and student engagement and experiential learning initiatives to include undergraduate research, service learning, community engagement, study away, and academic internships.

 
Essential Functions

Reporting to the Provost and Executive Vice President for Academic Affairs, the Vice President for Student Success will:

  • Provide overall leadership and administration for programming and services leading to student success in academics, college life, and the transition from college to the world of work or graduate school.
  • Play a key leadership role in ensuring the success of our students by requiring excellent and ongoing academic and student support services for all students, including traditional and non-traditional students, transfer students, graduate students, medical students, and international students, designed to increase retention and graduation rates while maintaining the highest standards of academic excellence.
  • Lead the implementation of a re-engineered student lifecycle management process, which includes advanced predictive analytics, new user interfaces, newly designed student success and enrollment service centers, integrated back-office operations, enhanced community impact, and a more holistic approach to managing student engagement.
  • Work collaboratively with the campus community to establish priorities for strategic academic and student life initiatives aimed at enhancing student success, fostering partnerships, and maximizing community impact. Provide leadership and oversight for development of policies and programs affecting academic and student life activities of the university aimed at enhancing student success.
  • Direct and manage Enrollment Management, Student Life, and Student Academic Support Services, which may include the first-year program, an honors program, advising, tutoring services, career services, student conduct, transfer services, and student engagement and experiential learning initiatives to include undergraduate research, service learning, community engagement, study away, and academic internships.
  • Facilitate continuous, effective, and seamless interaction, engagement, and coordination among and between Enrollment Management, Student Life, and Student Academic Support Services.
  • Support the use of predictive analytics to identify, understand, and communicate with individual students and faculty regarding expectations, challenges, and opportunities to ensure student success.
  • Coordinate regularly with IT to ensure the use and implementation of innovative technology with initiatives linked to student enrollment, student life, and student success.
  • Ensure active student engagement with the community through service learning, internships, and other initiatives aimed at integrating classroom learning with community impact.
  • Play a central role in student recruitment and enrollment.
  • Represent the University in the community on matters pertaining to student success.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

 
Required Qualifications
  • Doctorate in field of study.
  • At least five (5) years of continuous administrative experience.
  • Strong background and relevant experience in academic and student affairs.
  • Proven ability to work with innovative technologies and predictive analytics as they relate to student success initiatives.
  • Proven experience and success with student success initiatives.
  • Proven experience in working across divisions, especially Academic and Student Affairs.

 
Preferred Qualifications
  • Proven leadership and management skills.
  • Ability to communicate in a pragmatic and collegial way.
  • Ability to develop and implement a strategic plan for student success that is focused on making UTRGV one of the most successful institutions of higher education in the country.
  • Proven scholarly record in student success.
  • Teaching experience at university level.
  • Proven ability to integrate multiple departments.

 
Working Conditions
  • UTRGV is a distributed institution.  As such and as assigned, the position may require presence at multiple locations throughout the Rio Grande Valley.
  • Work is performed primarily in a general office environment.
  • This position is security-sensitive and thereby subject to the provisions of Texas Education Code § 51.215. 

 
Additional Information

The retirement plan for this position is Teacher Retirement System of Texas (TRS), subject to the position being at least 20 hours per week and at least 135 days in length. This position has the option to elect the Optional Retirement Program (ORP) instead of TRS, subject to the position being 40 hours per week and at least 135 days in length.
